column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////We arrived for an early lunch at 11:30 and were seated immediately but it was 15 minutes before a waitress came over and acknowledged us. Thus
column2: I had a bad impression early on. We decided to get a small "the Lou" pizza to split between two people. This is a veggie pizza with spinach
column4: and tomatoes. Since we knew the pizzas took a while
column5: we wanted an app and decided to go with the stuffed spinach bread. This bread was amazing and was the highlight of our meal...super cheesy and delicious. However
column6: we were disappointed with the pizza. The crust was bland and definitely not buttery considering that they call it their "buttercrust"
column7: and the cheese and toppings were just alright. Nothing to write home about.
